data.meta_description: Information about the Children and Young Adults Research Unit at the Noah's Ark Children's Hospital for Wales
data.meta_site_name: Cardiff and Vale University Health Board
data.text:
The Children and Young Adults Research Unit is situated within the Noah's Ark Children's Hospital for Wales. It offers the first protected research space for under 18s in Wales.

Meet our Research Team

Sian Elliot - Research Nurse (NICU)

Rhian Thomas -Turner - R&D Lead NACHfW and Operational Lead CYARU

Dr Philip Connor - Clinical Lead CYARU and R&D Lead Children and Women Clinical Board

Open Studies

COVID-19 Research

CYARU have recently participated in a number of COVID-related studies:

RAPID 19 – A study testing for COVID-19 antibodies in the children of healthcare workers —daro.qub.ac.uk/Impact-of-COVID-19-on-children?DeliveryChannelID=23b56292-0f3c-43ac-af13-7767ad9d4057 and noahsarkcharity.org/2020/09/03/rapid19/

CCMP — cclg.org.uk/coronavirus-data

ImmunoCOVID — uhs.nhs.uk/ClinicalResearchinSouthampton/Public-and-patients/Featured-research-studies/Featured-research-ImmunoCOVID19-study.aspx

RECOVERY — recoverytrial.net/

If you wish to contact us about the research we are involved in please contact:

Rhian Thomas-Turner

R&D Lead NACHfW/CYARU Operational Lead

Non-COVID-19 Research

We have a number of commercial and non-commercial research studies open including:

USTEKID — ype1diabetesresearch.org.uk/current-trials/ustekid/

AZTEC — cardiff.ac.uk/centre-for-trials-research/research/studies-and-trials/view/aztec

Project Sepsis — cardiff.ac.uk/research/explore/research-units/project-sepsis

The contribution of induced sputum sampling to surveillance of lower respiratory tract microbiology in children with Cystic Fibrosis
